alignments.name: From the Project Management Institute (PMI)
alignments.description: Project Management Institute is the world's leading association for those who consider project, program or portfolio management their profession. Through global advocacy, collaboration, education/research, PMI works to prepare more than three million professionals for the future in which work, and individuals, are organized around projects.

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of three (3) in-person workshops led by a PMP certified instructor in the body of knowledge work proffered by the Project Management Institute (PMI) outlining the methodology for managing complex projects.

673e821f-0330-43ee-bc1e-dced15e4cae3.description: The Digital Accessibility Workshop Series will introduce faculty and course designers to the fundamental principles of inclusive design and equip them with the skills necessary to ensure accessible course content and delivery. Participants will learn how to make existing content accessible and will explore strategies for building accessible materials in a variety of content authoring applications.
673e821f-0330-43ee-bc1e-dced15e4cae3.name: Digital Accessibility

issuer.summary: issued by The University of Alabama Teaching Innovation and Digital Education

entity.name: The University of Alabama Teaching Innovation and Digital Education

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of Digital Accessibility Series Part 1: Improving the Accessibility of Your Blackboard Course. Workshop objectives: 1) Recognize inaccessible course components. 2) Build accessible tests and quizzes. 3) Write prompts that facilitate accessible discussions. 4) Select accessible resources. 5) Identify methods for making Blackboard course content accessible. 6) Identify methods for making Zoom and Blackboard Collaborate accessible.

Completion of Digital Accessibility Series Part 2: Creating Accessible Media. Workshop objectives: 1) Locate accessibility resources on the UA campus. 2) Identify methods for making accessible media for your courses.

Completion of Digital Accessibility Series Part 3: Creating Accessible Documents and Resources. Workshop objectives: 1) Identify methods for authoring accessible documents. 2) Practice strategies for remediating documents and resources to ensure accessibility.

1a0ac803-5429-4ed2-817c-441aa769e933.description: The Maintenance Management Certificate Program badge signifies the completion of the University of Alabama Teaching Innovation and Digital Education Program requirements. 1a0ac803-5429-4ed2-817c-441aa769e933.name: Maintenance Management Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of seven live online workshops led by PROSCI-certified change management professionals, SME-certified Manufacturing Engineering Technologists, Certified Maintenance Reliability Professionals and ASE-Certified Master Mechanics instructors in the body of knowledge proffered by the Society for Maintenance & Reliability Professionals (SMRP) outlining the methodology for business management, equipment reliability, manufacturing process reliability, organization and leadership and work mgmt
